stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame:
# ‚öæ HELLO OSTERRA! ‚öæ 

Nok the Corrupter here, your favorite demon of the airwaves, coming to you live for the start of the ULTIMATE series! We have reset the bracket, folks, and now it is a Best of Five to decide who wears the crown forever! We are at Fletchings Field, where the druids are currently whispering to the grass and making the end zones move like a dizzy goblin! The energy is higher than a warlock on soul-dust! I see the hometown favorites, Oak & Onslaught, looking quite dapper... though Wynnie Faina and Normi Glaudia appear to have their boots on the wrong feet again! Ha! What tactical brilliance! üå≥ 

Meanwhile, the Chaos Creatures are in the dugout. Lian Denton is currently chugging a tin cup of steaming hot gravy! That's how you build a champion's constitution! Boulanger Procto is meticulously arranging his gear in a perfect spiral‚ÄîI'm sure he's hoping the druids don't spiral the field right out from under him! Grab your mugs, fans, because with an open bar and shifting terrain, this is going to be a glorious wreck! üç∫ 

Will Sir Randy and his fancy-pants rangers find a way to navigate their own shifting field, or will the Monteforte rebels turn this botanical garden into a graveyard? The blood is pumping, and the whistle is ready to scream! Let‚Äôs play Trollball! üî•üèà
postGame:
# üèÜ THE CHAOS CLAW THEIR WAY TO THE TOP! üèÜ 

Holy Mackerel, sports fans! What a way to start the Grand Finals series! You are listening to the sweet, gravelly voice of Nok the Corrupter, and my demonic heart is absolutely singing after that display of sheer, unadulterated violence! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have drawn first blood in this Best of Five, defeating the Warden favorites Oak & Onslaught with a score of 2 to 1! üèüÔ∏è‚ú® 

The match kicked off with Affra Yanaton scooping up the troll head in Center Field, but the Chaos Creatures weren't about to let the "heroes" have an easy path. Symer Crissy made a valiant run, but the real fireworks started when Millham Evangeline decided to introduce Gabriele Klehm's face to the dirt! Gabriele was sent straight to the healers‚Äîa beautiful, bone-crunching start that set the tone for the evening! üöë 

But don't you worry, the rebels from New Monteforte had plenty of fight in them! Placido Kora, looking like a woman possessed, delivered a tackle to Teria Ravo that likely rattled the very foundations of Fletchings Field! Teria was hauled off, much to the chagrin of the Warden fans who were already five mugs deep into the open bar! The stadium's Shifting Terrain started to show its teeth as players stumbled over roots that weren't there a second ago! üå≥ 

The carnage continued as Wolbrom Ariella leveled Millham Evangeline! I tell you, folks, the medical staff tonight is working harder than a demon in a soul-factory! Millham went down hard, and the Chaos Creatures showed that popularity doesn't mean a thing when a scythe is swinging at your shins! üè• 

Despite the pressure, the Wardens found a sliver of that "heroic" luck. Ema Ulrick managed to break through the defensive line and DUNKS the ball into the goal! A 1-point touchdown for the home team! Sir Randy must have been polishing his fancy bow in pride, but the Monteforte crowd was more interested in the street performers and the unstable scaffolding that nearly crushed a group of rangers! üèÄüí• 

Halftime hit, and let me tell you, the open bar was the real MVP. Half the fans are so pickled they think they're watching a game of catch with a regular ball! But the players were fueled by something stronger. Ahron Latashia and Lian Denton were busy stitching limbs back on as the teams prepared for a second half of absolute mayhem! üç∫ 

The second half was a symphony of destruction! Urata Oriana, fresh from his pre-game weapon-testing, decided Milt Casady didn't need to be upright anymore! Milt was sent to the sidelines, followed quickly by Ema Ulrick, who was leveled by Mouldon Earl! The Chaos Creatures were playing like they had a personal vendetta against anyone with a badge! ‚õìÔ∏è 

Mouldon Earl wasn't done, though! He went back for seconds and took out Millham Evangeline again! The consistency of the violence was truly inspiring! Even Symer Crissy got in on the action for the Wardens, injuring Placido Kora, but it was too little, too late for the favorites. The field was looking more like a hospital ward than a sports arena! üè•üî® 

Then came the play of the game! Urata Oriana, looking as cool as a frozen bog, found himself in Center Field with a clear line. He didn't run‚Äîhe launched a prayer! The troll head sailed through the air, past the reaching hands of the defenders, and SWISH! A 2-point Shoot that turned the game on its head! The Chaos Creatures surged into the lead 2-1! üéØüò± 

Oak & Onslaught tried to rally, with Wynnie Faina taking a long shot that sailed wide, likely because his boots were still on the wrong feet! Fogel Raynold snatched the rebound and the defense held firm. Tucker Hett even took a final shot that missed, but the clock was the real enemy of the heroes tonight! üöÆ 

When the final whistle blew, the Chaos Creatures stood tall in the mud! Final score: New Monteforte 2, Oak & Onslaught 1! The Wardens might have the flashy bows and the fancy titles, but the rebels have the first win of the series! Falric and Levania better find a way to fix this, or the Chaos is going to walk away with the whole crown! üèÜü§ò 

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a stadium full of drunk fans and broken bones! Stay violent, Osterra! See you for Game Two! üî•ü§ò
